tasks.name: Configure pre-commit framework
tasks.copilot_prompt:
Create comprehensive pre-commit configuration:

```yaml
repos:
  # General checks
  - repo: https://github.com/pre-commit/pre-commit-hooks
    rev: v4.5.0
    hooks:
      - id: trailing-whitespace
      - id: end-of-file-fixer
      - id: check-yaml
        args: [--allow-multiple-documents]
      - id: check-json
      - id: check-added-large-files
        args: [--maxkb=1000]
      - id: check-merge-conflict
      - id: check-case-conflict
      - id: mixed-line-ending

  # Bash/Shell scripts
  - repo: https://github.com/shellcheck-py/shellcheck-py
    rev: v0.9.0.6
    hooks:
      - id: shellcheck
        args: [-x, -e, SC1091]

  - repo: https://github.com/openstack/bashate
    rev: 2.1.1
    hooks:
      - id: bashate
        args: [-i, E006]

  # Python
  - repo: https://github.com/psf/black
    rev: 23.12.1
    hooks:
      - id: black
        language_version: python3.11

  - repo: https://github.com/pycqa/flake8
    rev: 7.0.0
    hooks:
      - id: flake8
        args: [--max-line-length=100, --extend-ignore=E203]

  - repo: https://github.com/pycqa/isort
    rev: 5.13.2
    hooks:
      - id: isort
        args: [--profile, black]

  # Go
  - repo: https://github.com/golangci/golangci-lint
    rev: v1.55.2
    hooks:
      - id: golangci-lint

  # Terraform
  - repo: https://github.com/antonbabenko/pre-commit-terraform
    rev: v1.86.0
    hooks:
      - id: terraform_fmt
      - id: terraform_validate
      - id: terraform_tflint
      - id: terraform_docs

  # Markdown
  - repo: https://github.com/igorshubovych/markdownlint-cli
    rev: v0.38.0
    hooks:
      - id: markdownlint
        args: [--fix]

  # YAML
  - repo: https://github.com/adrienverge/yamllint
    rev: v1.33.0
    hooks:
      - id: yamllint
        args: [-c, .yamllint.yml]

  # Secrets detection
  - repo: https://github.com/gitleaks/gitleaks
    rev: v8.18.1
    hooks:
      - id: gitleaks
```

tasks.copilot_prompt:
Create configuration files for each linter:

**1. .yamllint.yml**
```yaml
extends: default

rules:
  line-length:
    max: 120
    level: warning
  indentation:
    spaces: 2
  comments:
    min-spaces-from-content: 1
  document-start: disable
```

**2. .flake8**
```ini
[flake8]
max-line-length = 100
extend-ignore = E203, W503
exclude =
    .git,
    __pycache__,
    .venv,
    venv,
    build,
    dist
```

**3. .golangci.yml**
```yaml
linters:
  enable:
    - gofmt
    - golint
    - govet
    - errcheck
    - staticcheck
    - gosimple
    - ineffassign
    - unused

linters-settings:
  golint:
    min-confidence: 0.8
```

**4. .markdownlint.json**
```json
{
  "default": true,
  "MD013": false,
  "MD033": false,
  "MD041": false
}
```

**5. .tflint.hcl**
```hcl
config {
  module = true
  force = false
}

plugin "aws" {
  enabled = true
  version = "0.28.0"
  source  = "github.com/terraform-linters/tflint-ruleset-aws"
}

rule "terraform_naming_convention" {
  enabled = true
}

rule "terraform_typed_variables" {
  enabled = true
}
```

tasks.name: Create quality check workflow
tasks.copilot_prompt:
Create comprehensive quality check workflow:

```yaml
name: Code Quality Checks

on:
  pull_request:
    branches: [main, develop]
  push:
    branches: [main, develop]

jobs:
  lint:
    name: Lint Code
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.11'
      
      - name: Set up Go
        uses: actions/setup-go@v5
        with:
          go-version: '1.21'
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          pip install black flake8 isort
          go install github.com/golangci/golangci-lint/cmd/golangci-lint@latest
      
      - name: Run pre-commit
        uses: pre-commit/action@v3.0.0

  format-check:
    name: Check Formatting
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Check Python formatting
        run: black --check .
      
      - name: Check Go formatting
        run: |
          if [ -n "$(gofmt -l .)" ]; then
            echo "Go files not formatted:"
            gofmt -l .
            exit 1
          fi
      
      - name: Check Terraform formatting
        run: terraform fmt -check -recursive .

  security-scan:
    name: Security Scanning
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Run Gitleaks
        uses: gitleaks/gitleaks-action@v2
      
      - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
        uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
        with:
          scan-type: 'fs'
          scan-ref: '.'
          severity: 'CRITICAL,HIGH'

  test-coverage:
    name: Test Coverage
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Run tests with coverage
        run: make test-coverage
      
      - name: Check coverage threshold
        run: |
          COVERAGE=$(cat coverage.txt | grep -oP 'total.*\K[0-9.]+(?=%)')
          if (( $(echo "$COVERAGE < 70" | bc -l) )); then
            echo "Coverage $COVERAGE% below 70% threshold"
            exit 1
          fi
      
      - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
        with:
          file: ./coverage.txt
```

tasks.name: Create coding standards document
tasks.copilot_prompt:
Create comprehensive coding standards documentation:

# Coding Standards

## Overview

This document defines code quality standards for Fawkes. All contributions must adhere to these standards.

## Automated Enforcement

- **Pre-commit hooks**: Run `pre-commit install` after cloning
- **CI/CD checks**: All PRs must pass quality gates
- **Format-on-save**: Configure your editor (see setup guide)

## General Principles

1. **Readability over cleverness**: Code is read more than written
2. **Consistency**: Follow language idioms and conventions
3. **Documentation**: Comment the "why", not the "what"
4. **Testing**: All code must have tests (70%+ coverage)
5. **Security**: Never commit secrets or sensitive data

## Language-Specific Standards

### Bash/Shell Scripts

**Style Guide**: [Google Shell Style Guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/shellguide.html)

**Key Rules**:
- Use `#!/usr/bin/env bash` shebang
- Enable strict mode: `set -euo pipefail`
- Quote variables: `"${var}"` not `$var`
- Use functions for reusability
- Error messages to stderr: `>&2`
- Exit codes: 0 success, non-zero failure

**Example**:
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

function error() {
  echo "ERROR: $*" >&2
  exit 1
}

function main() {
  local input="${1:-}"
  if [[ -z "${input}" ]]; then
    error "Input required"
  fi
}

main "$@"
```

**Linters**: shellcheck, bashate
**Formatter**: shfmt (2-space indent)

### Python

**Style Guide**: [PEP 8](https://pep8.org/)

**Key Rules**:
- Use type hints for functions
- Docstrings for all public functions
- 100 character line length (Black default)
- Use f-strings for formatting
- Import order: stdlib, third-party, local

**Example**:
```python
from typing import Optional

def calculate_dora_score(deployments: int, failures: int) -> Optional[float]:
    """Calculate DORA performance score.
    
    Args:
        deployments: Total deployment count
        failures: Failed deployment count
    
    Returns:
        Score from 0-100, or None if invalid input
    """
    if deployments <= 0:
        return None
    return ((deployments - failures) / deployments) * 100
```

**Linters**: flake8, black, isort
**Formatter**: black (automatic)

### Go

**Style Guide**: [Effective Go](https://go.dev/doc/effective_go)

**Key Rules**:
- Use gofmt for formatting
- Error handling: always check errors
- Package comments required
- Use context for cancellation
- Interfaces: accept, return concrete

**Linters**: golangci-lint
**Formatter**: gofmt (automatic)

### Terraform

**Style Guide**: [HashiCorp Terraform Style](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/style)

**Key Rules**:
- Use modules for reusability
- Variables: type constraints required
- Outputs: descriptions required
- Resource naming: `<resource_type>_<name>`
- Use data sources instead of hardcoding

**Example**:
```hcl
variable "cluster_name" {
  description = "Kubernetes cluster name"
  type        = string
  validation {
    condition     = length(var.cluster_name) > 0
    error_message = "Cluster name cannot be empty"
  }
}
```

**Linters**: tflint
**Formatter**: terraform fmt

## Code Review Checklist

- [ ] All linters pass
- [ ] Code is formatted correctly
- [ ] Tests added/updated
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] No secrets in code
- [ ] Error handling present
- [ ] Security implications considered
- [ ] Performance implications considered

## Common Issues & Solutions

See FAQ section for solutions to common linting errors.

Include 20+ common issues with solutions.
